description.narrative: This continuation project carries on the work that began in 2015 to empower migrant workers in Thailand. The two year continuation will be the last phase of the project and the main purpose of the continuation is to ensure the successful completion of the project?s exit-strategy.As in previous years this project will combine grassroots negotiations in Thailand with European level media and corporate social responsibility advocacy work.The main objective for the final years 2019 and 2020 of the project is th e ensure the sustainability of the results achieved during the whole project period. Central to this are lobbying for improvements to legislation in Thailand and developing the administrative and fundraising capacity of the project partner Migrants Rights Network (MWRN). The continuation project will be human rights transformative. The project will mobilise European companies to advocate the Thai Government to ratify ILO core conventions on freedom of association and collective bargaining. MWRN membership r ecruitment will be developed to respond to the challenges identified in the previous project phase. The objective is for MWRN to be able to continue with empowering and organising migrant workers supported by their own fundraising once the project is compl ete.
